verses.verse: I said <S%H559><s%> in my heart <S%H3820><s%>, Go to now <S%H3212><s%>, I will prove <S%H5254><s%> you with mirth <S%H8057><s%>, therefore enjoy <S%H7200><s%> pleasure <S%H2896><s%>: and <S%H1892><s%>, behold, this also is vanity.
I said <S%H559><s%> of laughter <S%H7814><s%>, It is mad <S%H1984><s%>: and of mirth <S%H8057><s%>, What <S%H2090><s%> does it <S%H6213><s%>?

I sought <S%H8446><s%> in my heart <S%H3820><s%> to give <S%H4900><s%> myself <S%H1320><s%> unto wine <S%H3196><s%>, yet acquainting <S%H5090><s%> my heart <S%H3820><s%> with wisdom <S%H2451><s%>; and to lay hold <S%H270><s%> on wickedness <S%H5531><s%>, until I might see <S%H7200><s%> what was that good <S%H2896><s%> for the sons <S%H1121><s%> of men <S%H120><s%>, which they should do <S%H6213><s%> under the heaven <S%H8064><s%> all <S%H4557><s%> the days <S%H3117><s%> of their life <S%H2416><s%>.
I made for me great <S%H1431><s%> works <S%H4639><s%>; I built <S%H1129><s%> houses <S%H1004><s%>; I planted <S%H5193><s%> vineyards <S%H3754><s%>:
I made <S%H6213><s%> for me gardens <S%H1593><s%> and orchards <S%H6508><s%>, and I planted <S%H5193><s%> trees <S%H6086><s%> in them of all kind of fruits <S%H6529><s%>:
I made <S%H6213><s%> for me pools <S%H1295><s%> of water <S%H4325><s%>, to water <S%H8248><s%> with it the wood <S%H3293><s%> that brings forth <S%H6779><s%> trees <S%H6086><s%>:

I got <S%H7069><s%> for me servants <S%H5650><s%> and maidens <S%H8198><s%>, and had servants born <S%H1121><s%> in my house <S%H1004><s%>; also I had great <S%H7235><s%> possessions <S%H4735><s%> of great <S%H1241><s%> and small cattle <S%H6629><s%> above all that were in Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> before me <S%H6440><s%>:

I gathered <S%H3664><s%> for me also silver <S%H3701><s%> and gold <S%H2091><s%>, and the peculiar treasure <S%H5459><s%> of kings <S%H4428><s%> and of the provinces <S%H4082><s%>: I got <S%H6213><s%> me men singers <S%H7891><s%> and women singers <S%H7891><s%>, and the delights <S%H8588><s%> of the sons <S%H1121><s%> of men <S%H120><s%>, as musical instruments <S%H7705><s%>, and that of all sorts.
So I was great <S%H1431><s%>, and increased <S%H3254><s%> more than all that were before <S%H6440><s%> me in Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>: also my wisdom <S%H2451><s%> remained with me <S%H5975><s%>.

And whatever my eyes <S%H5869><s%> desired <S%H7592><s%> I kept <S%H680><s%> not from them <S%H4513><s%>, I withheld not my heart <S%H3820><s%> from any joy <S%H8057><s%>; for my heart <S%H3820><s%> rejoiced <S%H8056><s%> in all my labor <S%H5999><s%>: and this was my portion <S%H2506><s%> of all my labor <S%H5999><s%>.

Then I looked <S%H6437><s%> on all the works <S%H4639><s%> that my hands <S%H3027><s%> had done <S%H6213><s%>, and on the labor <S%H5999><s%> that I had labored <S%H5998><s%> to do <S%H6213><s%>: and <S%H1892><s%>, behold, all was vanity and vexation <S%H7469><s%> of spirit <S%H7307><s%>, and there was no profit <S%H3504><s%> under the sun <S%H8121><s%>.

And I turned <S%H6437><s%> myself to behold <S%H7200><s%> wisdom <S%H2451><s%>, and madness <S%H1947><s%>, and wickedness <S%H5531><s%>: for what can the man <S%H120><s%> do that comes <S%H935><s%> after <S%H310><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%>? even that which has been already <S%H3528><s%> done <S%H6213><s%>.
Then I saw <S%H7200><s%> that <S%H3426><s%> wisdom <S%H2451><s%> excels <S%H3504><s%> wickedness <S%H5531><s%>, as far as light <S%H216><s%> excels <S%H3504><s%> darkness <S%H2822><s%>.

The wise man <S%H2450><s%>'s eyes <S%H5869><s%> are in his head <S%H7218><s%>; but the fool <S%H3684><s%> walks <S%H1980><s%> in darkness <S%H2822><s%>: and I myself perceived <S%H3045><s%> also that one <S%H259><s%> event <S%H4745><s%> happens to them all <S%H7136><s%>.

Then <S%H227><s%> said <S%H559><s%> I in my heart <S%H3820><s%>, As it happens <S%H4745><s%> to the fool <S%H3684><s%>, so it happens <S%H7136><s%> even to me <S%H1571><s%>; and why was I then more <S%H3148><s%> wise <S%H2449><s%>? Then I said <S%H1696><s%> in my heart <S%H3820><s%>, that this also is vanity <S%H1892><s%>.

For there is no memory <S%H2146><s%> of the wise <S%H2450><s%> more than <S%H5973><s%> of the fool <S%H3684><s%> for ever <S%H5769><s%>; seeing that which now <S%H3528><s%> is in the days <S%H3117><s%> to come <S%H935><s%> shall all be forgotten <S%H7911><s%>. And how dies <S%H4191><s%> the wise <S%H2450><s%> man <S%H3684><s%>? as the fool.

Therefore I hated <S%H8130><s%> life <S%H2416><s%>; because the work <S%H4639><s%> that is done <S%H6213><s%> under the sun <S%H8121><s%> is grievous <S%H7451><s%> unto me <S%H1892><s%>: for all is vanity and vexation <S%H7469><s%> of spirit <S%H7307><s%>.

Yes <S%H8130><s%>, I hated all my labor <S%H5999><s%> which I had taken <S%H6001><s%> under the sun <S%H8121><s%>: because I should leave <S%H3240><s%> it unto the man <S%H120><s%> that shall be after me <S%H310><s%>.

And who knows <S%H3045><s%> whether he shall be a wise <S%H2450><s%> man or a fool <S%H5530><s%>? yet shall he have rule <S%H7980><s%> over all my labor <S%H5999><s%> where I have labored <S%H5998><s%>, and where I have showed myself wise <S%H2449><s%> under the sun <S%H8121><s%>. This is also vanity <S%H1892><s%>.
Therefore I went about <S%H5437><s%> to cause <S%H2976><s%> my heart <S%H3820><s%> to despair <S%H2976><s%> of all the labor <S%H5999><s%> which I took <S%H5998><s%> under the sun <S%H8121><s%>.

For there is <S%H3426><s%> a man <S%H120><s%> whose labor <S%H5999><s%> is in wisdom <S%H2451><s%>, and in knowledge <S%H1847><s%>, and in equity <S%H3788><s%>; yet to a man <S%H120><s%> that has not labored <S%H5998><s%> in it shall he leave <S%H5414><s%> it for his portion <S%H2506><s%>. This also is vanity <S%H1892><s%> and a great <S%H7227><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%>.

For what has <S%H1933><s%> man <S%H120><s%> of all his labor <S%H5999><s%>, and of the vexation <S%H7475><s%> of his heart <S%H3820><s%>, where <S%H1931><s%> he has labored <S%H6001><s%> under the sun <S%H8121><s%>?

For all his days <S%H3117><s%> are sorrows <S%H4341><s%>, and his hardship <S%H6045><s%> grief <S%H3708><s%>; Yes <S%H3820><s%>, his heart takes not rest <S%H7901><s%> in the night <S%H3915><s%>. This is also vanity <S%H1892><s%>.

There is nothing better <S%H2896><s%> for a man <S%H120><s%>, than that he should eat <S%H398><s%> and drink <S%H8354><s%>, and that he should make his soul <S%H5315><s%> enjoy <S%H7200><s%> good <S%H2896><s%> in his labor <S%H5999><s%>. This <S%H2090><s%> also I saw <S%H7200><s%>, that it was from the hand <S%H3027><s%> of God <S%H430><s%>.
For who can eat <S%H398><s%>, or who else can hasten <S%H2363><s%> hereunto <S%H2351><s%>, more than I?

For God gives <S%H5414><s%> to a man <S%H120><s%> that is good <S%H2896><s%> in his sight <S%H6440><s%> wisdom <S%H2451><s%>, and knowledge <S%H1847><s%>, and joy <S%H8057><s%>: but to the sinner <S%H2398><s%> he gives <S%H5414><s%> hardship <S%H6045><s%>, to gather <S%H622><s%> and to heap up <S%H3664><s%>, that he may give <S%H5414><s%> to him that is good <S%H2896><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> God <S%H430><s%>. This also is vanity <S%H1892><s%> and vexation <S%H7469><s%> of spirit <S%H7307><s%>.
